intro: Belloa catamarcensis, commonly known as the Catamarcensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andean regions of Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it adapts to harsh climatic conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, seed-bearing structures called achenes. Belloa catamarcensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
